meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of primates.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper studied the primatal behavior of the monkeys.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often conduct research on primatal species to learn more about evolution.
meanings.sent3: The primatal antics of the chimpanzees never failed to entertain the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her primatal instincts kicked in when she saw the baby gorilla in distress.
meanings.sent5: The primatal features of the lemurs made them stand out among other animals.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the order Primates.
meanings.sent1: The primatal classification includes various species like apes and lemurs.
meanings.sent2: Zoologists study the primatal characteristics of different primate families.
meanings.sent3: The primatal exhibit at the museum showcased the diversity of primate species.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the primatal sounds of monkeys echoed through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The primatal adaptations of primates help them thrive in their environments.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a primate.
meanings.sent1: Her primatal features, like the opposable thumbs, were similar to those of primates.
meanings.sent2: The primatal behavior of the child reminded the teacher of primate social interactions.
meanings.sent3: The primatal costume at the party was a hit among the guests.
meanings.sent4: His primatal instincts told him to climb the tree for a better view.
meanings.sent5: The primatal movements of the actor in the ape costume were incredibly realistic.
